name: One On One (Mark Sheeky)
description:
A tank battle game for Amiga & Amiga emulators. My 4th Amiga game, I originally released this game in June 1992.

One On One is a two-player only combat game. Two tanks face off in a maze-like arena and both players use a joystick. You can't about turn, so there is a slight advantage to sneaking up behind your opponent. There is no AI play, so the game is only useful when playing with a friend.

It's a very simple game, originally made in about two weeks. It was my first two-player game, made to play with my brother (we used to play the cave flyer Bratwurst all of the time).

Supplied in ADF format for use with Amiga emulators, and in RP9 format for use with Cloanto's Amiga Forever and other RetroPlatform emulators.
